DataElement.preferredName: Quality of Life Report Upload Module Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the QoL report upload module type.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness._A short textual account; having provided a short account.:To transfer a file or program to a central computer from a smaller computer or a computer at a remote location.

Property.preferredDefinition: To transfer a file or program to a central computer from a smaller computer or a computer at a remote location.

Concepts.definition: To transfer a file or program to a central computer from a smaller computer or a computer at a remote location.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A self-contained component (unit or item) that is used in combination with other components._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: General; lacking specificity._The center of an object; indispensable

Concepts.definition: The center of an object; indispensable

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product._An instrument used either to capture a subject's condition or symptoms, or to monitor compliance during a clinical trial or disease treatment while away from the clinical site.

Concepts.definition: A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
An instrument used either to capture a subject's condition or symptoms, or to monitor compliance during a clinical trial or disease treatment while away from the clinical site.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Physical Activity Measurement
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._A measurement of a subject's physical activity or movement.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.
A measurement of a subject's physical activity or movement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A determination of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.

Concepts.definition: A determination of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lee Chronic Graft-versus-Host Disease Symptom Scale
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A self-report questionnaire containing 30 items in 7 subscales (skin, eye, mouth, lung, nutrition, energy, and psychological), developed to measure symptoms of chronic graft-versus-host disease. Patients report their level of symptom bother on a 5-point Likert scale.

Concepts.longName: Lee Chronic Graft-versus-Host Disease Symptom Scale
Concepts.definition: A self-report questionnaire containing 30 items in 7 subscales (skin, eye, mouth, lung, nutrition, energy, and psychological), developed to measure symptoms of chronic graft-versus-host disease. Patients report their level of symptom bother on a 5-point Likert scale.
